name: discontinuously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that has breaks, or that stops and starts again: Berber peoples are discontinuously distributed from the Atlantic to Egypt. Workers who are employed discontinuously are entitled to leave proportional to the total number of days worked in the year.
More examplesFewer examplesSediments are discontinuously and thinly developed in the central area.The outcrops extend discontinuously for more than 25 kilometres.The insects were discontinuously observed for 60 minutes at one minute intervals.
